content:
GridViewHeaderRowPresenter Class

In this Article

Represents an object that is used to define the layout of a row of column headers.

Syntax

Declaration

[System.Windows.StyleTypedProperty(Property="ColumnHeaderContainerStyle", StyleTargetType=typeof(System.Windows.Controls.GridViewColumnHeader))]
public class GridViewHeaderRowPresenter : System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.GridViewRowPresenterBase

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • DispatcherObject
  • DependencyObject
  • Visual
  • UIElement
  • FrameworkElement
  • System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.GridViewRowPresenterBase
  • GridViewHeaderRowPresenter

Remarks

This GridViewRowPresenter object and GridViewHeaderRowPresenter objects are support objects for the GridView View mode that displays data in columns for a ListView. For more information about how to define a GridView view, see the GridView Overview.

You can determine when a column is moving to a new location by monitoring the CollectionChanged event that is defined for the GridViewColumnCollection.

You can customize column headers in a GridView view mode by using a variety of properties that are found in this class and in related classes. For more information about these properties, and about the precedence between them, see GridView Column Header Styles and Templates Overview.

Constructors summary

GridViewHeaderRowPresenter()

Initializes a new instance of the GridViewHeaderRowPresenter class.

Identifies the stem.Windows.Controls.GridViewHeaderRowPresenter.AllowsColumnReorder* dependency property.

ColumnHeaderToolTipProperty

Identifies the stem.Windows.Controls.GridViewHeaderRowPresenter.ColumnHeaderToolTip* dependency property.

Properties summary

AllowsColumnReorder

Gets or sets a value that indicates whether columns can change positions.
ColumnHeaderContainerStyle

Gets or sets the Style to use for the column headers.
ColumnHeaderContextMenu

Gets or sets a ContextMenu for the column headers.
ColumnHeaderStringFormat

Gets or sets a composite string that specifies how to format the column headers if they are displayed as strings.
ColumnHeaderTemplate

Gets or sets the template to use to display the column headers.
ColumnHeaderTemplateSelector

Gets or sets a DataTemplateSelector that provides logic that selects the data template to use to display a column header.
ColumnHeaderToolTip

Gets or sets the content for a tooltip for the column header row.

Methods summary

ArrangeOverride(Size)

Arranges the content of the header row elements, and computes the actual size of the header row.
MeasureOverride(Size)

Determines the area that is required to display the column header row.
OnCreateAutomationPeer()

Creates an AutomationPeer object for the column header row.
OnLostMouseCapture(MouseEventArgs)

Provides class handling for the LostMouseCapture event for the GridViewColumnHeader.
OnMouseLeftButtonDown(MouseButtonEventArgs)

Provides class handling for the MouseLeftButtonDown event that occurs when the user presses the left mouse button inside a GridViewColumnHeader.
OnMouseLeftButtonUp(MouseButtonEventArgs)

Provides class handling for the MouseLeftButtonUp event that occurs when the user releases the left mouse button.
OnMouseMove(MouseEventArgs)

Provides class handling for the MouseMove event that occurs when the user moves the mouse.

Properties

  • AllowsColumnReorder

    Gets or sets a value that indicates whether columns can change positions.

    public bool AllowsColumnReorder { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if columns can be moved by the drag-and-drop operation of a column header; otherwise, false. The default is true.

    Remarks

    When you implement this class as part of a GridView view mode, the value of this property is bound to the value of the AllowsColumnReorder property on the GridView.

    Dependency Property Information
    Identifier field AllowsColumnReorderProperty
    Metadata properties set to true None
  • ColumnHeaderContainerStyle

    Gets or sets the Style to use for the column headers.

    public System.Windows.Style ColumnHeaderContainerStyle { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Style

      The Style to use for the column header container. The default is null.

    Remarks

    When you implement this class as part of a GridView view mode, the value of this property is bound to the value of the ColumnHeaderContainerStyle property on the GridView.

    You can customize column headers in a GridView view mode by using a variety of properties that are found in this class and in related classes. For more information about these properties, and about the precedence between them, see GridView Column Header Styles and Templates Overview.

    When you set styles, some restrictions apply. For more information, see the Styling and Templating.

    XAML Attribute Usage

    <object ColumnHeaderContainerStyle="{ResourceExtension StyleResourceKey}"/>

    XAML Property Element Usage

    XAML Values

    ResourceExtension
    One of the following: StaticResource, or DynamicResource. See XAML Resources.

    StyleResourceKey
    The key that identifies the style being requested. The key refers to an existing resource in a ResourceDictionary.

    Note

    Property element syntax is technically possible, but not recommended. See Inline Styles and Templates. A binding reference using or is also possible, but uncommon.

    Dependency Property Information
    Identifier field ColumnHeaderContainerStyleProperty
    Metadata properties set to true None
  • ColumnHeaderContextMenu

    Gets or sets a ContextMenu for the column headers.

    public System.Windows.Controls.ContextMenu ColumnHeaderContextMenu { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • ContextMenu

      The ContextMenu for the column header row. The default is null.

    Remarks

    When you implement this class as part of a GridView view mode, the value of this property is bound to the value of the ColumnHeaderContextMenu property on the GridView.

    You can customize column headers in a GridView view mode by using a variety of properties that are found in this class and in related classes. For more information about these properties, and about the precedence between them, see GridView Column Header Styles and Templates Overview.

    Dependency Property Information
    Identifier field ColumnHeaderContextMenuProperty
    Metadata properties set to true None
  • ColumnHeaderStringFormat

    Gets or sets a composite string that specifies how to format the column headers if they are displayed as strings.

    public string ColumnHeaderStringFormat { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      A composite string that specifies how to format the column headers if they are displayed as strings. The default is null.

    Remarks

    If the ColumnHeaderTemplate, HeaderTemplate, or ColumnHeaderTemplate property is set, this property is ignored.

    You can use several properties to specify the format of the column headers. If more than one property is set, the column header is formatted with the value of the property that has the highest priority. The format for a column can be set on several types. The following list shows the properties that can be used to format the column headers, ordered from lowest to highest priority:

    • ColumnHeaderStringFormat

    • ColumnHeaderStringFormat

    • HeaderStringFormat

    Dependency Property Information
    Identifier field ColumnHeaderStringFormatProperty
    Metadata properties set to true None
  • ColumnHeaderTemplate

    Gets or sets the template to use to display the column headers.

    public System.Windows.DataTemplate ColumnHeaderTemplate { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • DataTemplate

      The DataTemplate that is used to display the column header content. The default is null.

    Remarks

    When you implement this class as part of a GridView view mode, the value of this property is bound to the value of the ColumnHeaderTemplate property on the GridView.

    If the ColumnHeaderTemplate property and the ColumnHeaderTemplateSelector property are both set, the ColumnHeaderTemplate takes precedence.

    You can customize column headers in a GridView view mode by using a variety of properties that are found in this class and in related classes. For more information about these properties, and about the precedence between them, see GridView Column Header Styles and Templates Overview.

    XAML Attribute Usage

    <object ColumnHeaderTemplate="{ResourceExtension TemplateResourceKey}"/>

    XAML Property Element Usage

    XAML Values

    ResourceExtension
    One of the following: StaticResource, or DynamicResource. See XAML Resources.

    TemplateResourceKey
    The key that identifies the template being requested. The key refers to an existing resource in a ResourceDictionary.

    Note

    Property element syntax is technically possible, but not recommended. See Inline Styles and Templates. A binding reference using or is also possible, but uncommon.

  • ColumnHeaderTemplateSelector

    Gets or sets a DataTemplateSelector that provides logic that selects the data template to use to display a column header.

    public System.Windows.Controls.DataTemplateSelector ColumnHeaderTemplateSelector { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • DataTemplateSelector

      The DataTemplateSelector that chooses the DataTemplate to use to display each column header. The default is null.

    Remarks

    If the ColumnHeaderTemplate property and the ColumnHeaderTemplateSelector property are both set, the ColumnHeaderTemplate takes precedence.

    When you implement this class as part of a GridView view mode, the value of this property is bound to the value of the ColumnHeaderTemplateSelector property on the GridView.

    You can customize column headers in a GridView view mode by using a variety of properties that are found in this class and in related classes. For more information about these properties, and about the precedence between them, see GridView Column Header Styles and Templates Overview.

    XAML Attribute Usage

    <object ColumnHeaderTemplateSelector="{ResourceExtension DataTemplateSelectorClassKey}"/>

    XAML Property Element Usage

    <object>  
  <object.ColumnHeaderTemplateSelector>  
    <MyDataTemplateSelectorImplementation .../>  
  </object.ColumnHeaderTemplateSelector>  
</object>

    XAML Values

    MyDataTemplateSelectorImplementation
    A class derived from DataTemplateSelector that implements a practical SelectTemplate override. For information about how to map your custom class, see XAML Namespaces and Namespace Mapping for WPF XAML.

    ResourceExtension
    One of the following: StaticResource, or DynamicResource. See XAML Resources.

    DataTemplateSelectorClassKey
    The key that identifies the selector implementation being requested. The key refers to a derived class that implements a practical SelectTemplate override. For information about how to map your custom class, see XAML Namespaces and Namespace Mapping for WPF XAML. You can also programmatically add an instance of your DataTemplateSelector class as a resource to a resource dictionary.

  • ColumnHeaderToolTip

    Gets or sets the content for a tooltip for the column header row.

    public object ColumnHeaderToolTip { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Object

      An object that represents the content of a tooltip for the column headers.

    Remarks

    When you implement this class as part of a GridView view mode, the value of this property is bound to the value of the ColumnHeaderToolTip property on the GridView.

    You can customize column headers in a GridView view mode by using a variety of properties that are found in this class and in related classes. For more information about these properties, and about the precedence between them, see GridView Column Header Styles and Templates Overview.

    XAML Attribute Usage

    <object ToolTip="toolTipContent"/>

    XAML Property Element Usage

    <object>  
  <object.ToolTip>  
    <ToolTip .../>  
  </object.ToolTip>  
</object>  
- or -  
<object>  
  <object.ToolTip>  
    toolTipObjectContent  
  </object.ToolTip>  
</object>

    XAML Values

    toolTipContent
    A string that becomes the display text for the ColumnHeaderToolTip.

    toolTipObjectContent
    An object to use as the content for the tooltip. Typically, this object is a FrameworkElement or some other element that defines a layout for the ColumnHeaderToolTip, such as a text element. In this usage, a ToolTip element is implicitly created from the parsed XAML, and the toolTipObjectContent content is set as its Content property.

    <ToolTip .../>
    See ToolTip.

    Dependency Property Information
    Identifier field ColumnHeaderToolTipProperty
    Metadata properties set to true None

Methods

  • ArrangeOverride(Size)

    Arranges the content of the header row elements, and computes the actual size of the header row.

    protected override System.Windows.Size ArrangeOverride (System.Windows.Size arrangeSize);

    Parameters

    • arrangeSize
      Size

      The area that is available for the column header row.

    Returns

    • Size

      The actual Size for the column header row.

  • MeasureOverride(Size)

    Determines the area that is required to display the column header row.

    protected override System.Windows.Size MeasureOverride (System.Windows.Size constraint);

    Parameters

    • constraint
      Size

      The amount of area that is available to display the column header row.

    Returns

    • Size

      The required Size for the column header row.

  • OnCreateAutomationPeer()

    Creates an AutomationPeer object for the column header row.

    protected override System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer OnCreateAutomationPeer ();

    Returns

    • AutomationPeer

      A GridViewHeaderRowPresenterAutomationPeer object for this column header row.

  • OnLostMouseCapture(MouseEventArgs)

    Provides class handling for the LostMouseCapture event for the GridViewColumnHeader.

    protected override void OnLostMouseCapture (System.Windows.Input.MouseEventArgs e);

    Parameters

    • e
      MouseEventArgs

      The event data.

    Remarks

    If a LostMouseCapture event occurs while a column is moving to a new position, the move is canceled.

    This implementation does not handle the LostMouseCapture event.

  • OnMouseLeftButtonDown(MouseButtonEventArgs)

    Provides class handling for the MouseLeftButtonDown event that occurs when the user presses the left mouse button inside a GridViewColumnHeader.

    protected override void OnMouseLeftButtonDown (System.Windows.Input.MouseButtonEventArgs e);

    Parameters

    • e
      MouseButtonEventArgs

      The event data.

    Remarks

    If AllowsColumnReorder is true, this method prepares a column to be dragged to another location in the column header row.

    This implementation handles the MouseLeftButtonDown event by setting the Handled event argument to true.

  • OnMouseLeftButtonUp(MouseButtonEventArgs)

    Provides class handling for the MouseLeftButtonUp event that occurs when the user releases the left mouse button.

    protected override void OnMouseLeftButtonUp (System.Windows.Input.MouseButtonEventArgs e);

    Parameters

    • e
      MouseButtonEventArgs

      The event data.

    Remarks

    If AllowsColumnReorder is true, and if the MouseLeftButtonUp event occurs after a column is dragged to a new location, the column is moved.

    This implementation handles the MouseLeftButtonUp event by setting the Handled event argument to true.

  • OnMouseMove(MouseEventArgs)

    Provides class handling for the MouseMove event that occurs when the user moves the mouse.

    protected override void OnMouseMove (System.Windows.Input.MouseEventArgs e);

    Parameters

    • e
      MouseEventArgs

      The event data.

    Remarks

    If the AllowsColumnReorder property is set to true and the user presses the left mouse button, this method implements the visual behavior that occurs when the user drags a GridViewColumnHeader to a new location. This method override sets the Handled event argument to true for the MouseMove event even if the user does not press the left mouse button.

rawMetadata.title: GridViewHeaderRowPresenter class | Microsoft Docs
